14111211111112113311.content:
"For the last time, we gotta put a stop to this!"

"But it's only been a few weeks."

"We're already breaking 300 pounds!"

"I know. Pretty good start, huh?"

"Start?! How fat do you plan on making us?!"

"Uh... As fat as Delia plans on making us, I guess."

Misty groaned. She opened her eyes partway to find herself...nowhere? Now opening her eyes all the way, she saw that was indeed the case. A black nothingness stretched out into infinity. Not a single ray of light to be found, yet she could somehow see her own hand as she held it in front of her face.

The two voices continued their arguing. They were loud and impossible to ignore, almost like they were inside her head. Weird. Also weird was the fact the two sounded identical. And it didn't sound like someone arguing with themself, though it kind of did at the same time. Not to mention familiar. In fact, they sounded just like...

"Me?"

The bickering stopped. Misty took the silence as her cue to push herself up to a sitting position. No floor existed beneath her, yet her hands and feet still felt resistance. They didn't feel any texture, like glass or concrete; some invisible force just stopped them at a certain point.

Once she sat up, she took a moment to examine her body. Naked from head to toe. It also seemed...unfinished, in a way. Like it hadn't yet chosen what kind of figure it wanted to be.

Misty stood and looked upon the bickering duo before her.

Two other Mistys. Same orange hair, same green eyes, even the same level of nudity. But they were polar opposites in every other regard.

The Misty on the left was lithe, athletic. She looked ready to jump in the pool back home and swim some laps with her Pokemon. Not too much muscle definition, but at least her body had some form to it. Her hair was done up in a side ponytail. Top to bottom, she was the spitting image of the old Misty.

By contrast, the Misty on the right was incredibly fat. Her face, for starters, was far softer and more rounded, framed by longer hair that just hung down without any styling. Her double chin sagged into a neck devoid of definition. Further down was a pair of breasts a couple sizes bigger than the other Misty's. And where thin Misty had a toned abdomen, fat Misty had a massive beach ball of a belly, its sides decorated with love handles. Puffy armed framed her torso. Beneath her gut sat a wide pair of hips matched with a butt that could cushion any seat, assuming it'd fit. And those thunder thighs, they looked like they'd always be touching no matter how far apart she spread her legs. Not to mention her calves. Or her cankles.

"It's about time you got here," thin Misty said, her curt tone matching her scowl.

"Yeah," fat Misty said, scratching her belly. Both her voice and expression were more lax than her counterpart. "Maybe you can help us settle things."

The Misty that was neither thin nor fat just stared at them. She didn't know what to think, what to say. They were definitely talking about her weight, judging by what she caught of their argument, but she couldn't muster up any meaningful input. It was as though her mind had been wiped clean to some extent, rending her incapable of saying or doing anything.

An extended moment of silence passed. Misty stared blankly at the other two, whom stared back at her expectantly. Thin Misty grew more visibly irritated by the moment, while fat Misty just gave a sort of questioning glance. The latter seemed almost indifferent, as if she felt this whole whatever it was didn't matter.

Finally, thin Misty broke the silence with a groan. "You're useless," she grumbled, turning her attention back to fat Misty. "Look, I'm the original here. I'm the way things used to be before Delia made you happen." She jabbed a finger into fat Misty's gut to emphasize her point. It sunk in up to the knuckle.

Fat Misty didn't even flinch. "Yeah? Well, I'm the way things are now."

"Again, only because of Delia. If she hadn't tricked us into being her personal test subject for that powder, we wouldn't even be having this discussion!"

"It's a good thing she did, then."

"No! It's not! How can you not see what's wrong with that?!"

"Look, I just like our little setup. That's worth overlooking any ethical concerns, right?"

Thin Misty moaned in exasperation, dragging her fingers down her face. "What about the gym? Or our sisters? We can't just abandon them!"

Fat Misty thought for a moment, then shrugged. "Eh. Too much hassle. I just wanna stay with Delia."

"After she tricked us?!"

"At least we're helping with the whole restaurant thing, right?"

"That could be a lie, for all we know!"

"Oh. Yeah, I guess that's true." Fat Misty gazed down at her belly, rubbing it as she contemplated for a good two seconds. Then she grinned. "Hey, that means more food for us!"

Thin Misty gawked at her rotund opposite. Flabbergasted, she stammered a series of false starts before groaning and and burying her face in her hands. "You're hopeless..."

She took a long, deep breath, let her arms fall back to her sides, and turned to face the observing Misty. "Okay, look. There's two of us and only one of you. That means you have to pick which one of us gets to be Misty. And that means if you want to lose all that-" she jabbed her thumb in fat Misty's direction "-you'll pick me."

"On the other hand," fat Misty interjected, "if you wanna finally get rid of that nagging voice in the back of your head and just enjoy yourself, pick me."

The two exchanged irritated glances with each other before focusing all their attention on the observing Misty. They stared at her expectantly, thin Misty putting her hands on her hips while fat Misty drummed her fingers on her belly. They waited in silence. And they waited, and waited, and...

But the observing Misty said nothing, did nothing. She just kept staring blankly. Behind all three of them, there was a massive mirror she hadn't noticed before. It reflected the backs of the other two Mistys while her own reflection stared back at her, eyes dull and unfocused. A perfect fit for a formless entity such as herself.

Finally, after what felt like an eternity of awkward silence, the observing Misty slowly parted her lips. Words finally came to mind as she inhaled. The other two leaned forward expectantly.

"Imprint..."

"Huh?" thin and fat Misty asked in unison.

"Imprint upon me. Give me a form, an identity."

Thin Misty glared. Fat Misty's expression turned thoughtful. Tilting her head to one side, the latter said, "Guess we'll have to do this ourselves."

As fat Misty waddled her way to the observing Misty's right, thin Misty let out a growling sigh, her shoulders sagging. "Fine," she said and took her place on the left.

Both nodded and moved forward. Just when it seemed they were going to trap the observing Misty between their bodies, a light enveloped them. It lasted for only a split second, and the observing Misty found herself alone once it vanished.

Silence reigned yet again. Misty watched her reflection. Both entered her, but only one would be able to imprint upon her. Which would it be...?

Eventually, she heard a voice.
14111211111112113311.title: The Heart of the Matter

141112111111121133112.content:
You're looking a bit skinny there...

Misty blinked. A voice in her head? It sounded chill, conversational. Just like that fat Misty from a few moments ago. But what happened to that thin one?

Oh, don't worry about her. She won't be bugging you anymore.

Huh. Okay then.

But what was that about her being skinny? She didn't look thin. For that matter, she didn't look like much of anything...

Exactly. You're barely there, and what is there's just wasting away. You don't want that, do you?

Well, no. Of course not.

Then let's fill you out a little.

Then, almost instantly, Misty's stomach surged outward. It went from zero to a muffin top to a bona fide gut. The sudden influx of weight pulled Misty forward, but she held her ground. Her belly hung over her waist a bit, slight folds on either side hinting at the beginnings of love handles.

Misty stared at her reflection in fascination. Shape! Definition! Her body had a tangible form to it now! Well, the start of one anyway. The belly was a good start, but everything else still looked blurry and out of focus. She needed more.

A warm and filling sensation enveloped her body. Her belly grew again, bigger and wider. It wasn't long before a crease began to form in the middle, starting from the belly button and working its way out from there. The faint beginnings of a second pair of love handles formed over the now fully realized first.

Oh, did I say a little? I meant a lot.

The fat spread. Hips widened, thighs thickened, calves puffed up, breasts bulged (though less so than everything else), arms expanded, even her face fattened up. A layer of pudge spread out from her center, softening everything and filling her with warmth.

As if a switch had been flipped, Misty found herself flooded with joy. A body! A real, solid- er, soft body! She ran her hands across her body, tracing every last curve.

And so many of those curves! And they were getting bigger by the second!

And you'll keep on getting bigger. Just stick with Delia and you can get as big as you want.

Yes, Delia... The one feeding her, caring for her.

Recalling her name caused another surge of fat. By now, it was apparent Misty's body favored a more pear shaped figure. Not to say her upper half was small by any means; her lower half was just that much bigger. A massive monster gut that could fill out most of her lap sagged down to a couch-hogging ass and hips.

Yeah, couch-hogging. Like Delia's couch. So soft and comfy, just like staying with her.

Soft and comfy...

That could describe several things. Her growing body. Delia's couch. Delia's doting affection. Delia herself.

See, you get it. I mean sure, there's that whole powder thing, but that doesn't change the fact you like the way things are.

True. The last two and a half weeks with Delia were the best Misty's ever had. Though the whole premise was built on dishonesty...

Eh, just ask her to be more honest. She could never say no to you. She might've lied and all, but she still cares for you. Maybe even loves you. I dunno. You'll have to ask.

Misty giggled, took her belly and shook it. Small ripples passed through the rest of her still growing body.

Yes, still growing. Bigger and bigger, fatter and fatter. Just what she wanted. Even if she hadn't intended to go down her current path, even if Delia's deception essentially forced her down said path, she liked... She loved it too much. Just eating and growing day after day, with loving Delia to keep her company.

She'd broken the 300 pound threshold recently, right? Such a massive contrast to who she was just a little while ago, both literally and figuratively. Yet it didn't feel like enough. Not when she could be bigger. Much, much bigger.

Yeah, yeah! There you go! Think big, eat big, grow big, and be big. It feels so good. You wouldn't want to give that up over a little white lie, would you?

No, of course not.

Misty's body finally stopped growing. She had become the exact same size as the fat Misty. Her formerly dull eyes now gleamed with pride at her reflection. She closed her eyes, inhaled deeply, and rubbed her belly lovingly. Exhaling, she opened her eyes and gave it a slap. Watching it ripple and jiggle from the impact made her heart race.

Lookin' good, girl. And now that you've got all your doubts out of the way, you can get to work on looking even better.

Indeed she could. No point in holding on to who she used to be. There was only room for one Misty.

"And this Misty needs all the room she can get."

------

Feelings Laid Bare: Now that Misty has her feelings sorted out, it's time to address Delia's. And what better way to do that than give last night's talk the closure it needs?

Dedication Alters Awareness: Misty's newfound resolve pushes her to gain weight more than ever before. Naturally, this means a lot more stuffing. But will her dedication break her free of her eating trances, or will it only deepen them?

Hedonistic Pleasure: Misty enjoys eating. She enjoys it a lot. And as that enjoyment grows with the rest of her, it begins to take on a...let's say different form.

Let's skip ahead another month or so.
1411121111111211332.content:
Misty looked up at the ceiling, rubbing her eyes which were still coated in a cloud of sleep.

As she awoke, Delia stepped through the doorway pulling a cart full of food behind her. “Good morning Misty dear!” the mother figure greeted. “Figured you might like breakfast in bed today.”

Forgetting her dream in the moment, Misty’s stomach churned as a tray of food was set before her. A stack of chocolate chip pancakes, tall enough to be part of Unova’s skyline, stood imposingly before her, doused in thick syrup. Beside it was a serving tray of grease coated calorie bombs, or as Misty called it, bacon. To wash it all down, she’d been given a pitcher filled with orange juice and a thick yellow-ish milkshake.

Eager to get to work, Misty grabbed hold of a fork and knife and began digging in. The staggering stack of flapjacks was eaten layer by layer, and the tower slowly reduced to nothing but a smear of chocolate and a pool of syrup. With each bite she choked down, she took a sip from the pitcher of orange juice, guzzling the rest down after her stack of hotcakes had vanished. Misty moved onto the bacon, putting handful after handful of greasy goodness into her mouth. When she was finally done with the bacon, Misty stopped, out of breath and stuffed beyond comprehension.

“What’s the matter dear? Full so soon? At least have a few sips of your shake before you’re done. I want to see what you think.”

Reluctantly, Misty pressed the glass of the pitcher to her lips and allowed the thick liquid passage. As soon as it touched her tongue, a jolt of pleasure shot through her spine. The more of the shake she drank, the less pressure she felt from within her stomach. It was cool, soothing. As she dribbled up the remnants of her shake, she felt a churning in her stomach.

She was hungry.

“So? What did you think?”

“That… was the greatest thing I’ve ever tasted!” Misty almost shouted.

“Well I’ve got plenty more if you want another.”

Another.

The word rang through her head, bouncing to and fro, repeating again and again.

Another. Another. Another. Another. Another. Another. Another. Another. Another. Another.

Misty’s mind snapped back to her dream, eating another batch of cookies. And another. And another. She felt a moment of clarity, acutely aware of how large she'd become. She felt the food in her stomach churn, and imagined it slowly accumulating into more fat. She felt the momentum of each movement cause her whole form to wobble and shake, testing the limits of her overtaxed clothes which fruitlessly worked their hardest to contain her expanding form. And strangest of all, she liked it.

“I would love another.”

“Alrighty dear! Be back with one more.” Delia walked back out of the room with dirty dishes in hand.

This is going to be great, Misty thought.

And so, Delia returned with another shake, which Misty guzzled down with vigor. When she finished, her eyes met with Delia’s once again.

“Could I please have another?”

------

Misty embraced her gluttony and allowed herself to be fed and pampered day in and day out.

The next day, another breakfast and bed was brought to her.

At dinner, she decided to have another slice of pizza, which turned into another, and another, until her third pizza of the night was gone.

At dessert, she had another cake instead of just one.

In downtime between meals, she always asked for that oh-so good “special shake” as Delia called it.

And another.

And another.

And another.

And another.

“Well sweetie, it’s just a little vitamin supplement is all. It’s supposed to help digest your meal” Delia said. “Speaking of which, have you noticed it working at all?”

Misty only cared for getting the food into her system the past two and a half weeks. What it did while it was inside was a mystery as far as she was concerned. “Um… maybe? I haven’t really paid much attention.”

“That’s good dearie.” Delia approached Misty’s bulky physique. “And might I say, you’ve never looked quite as stunning as you do now!” A hand gestured to the girl’s growing body for emphasis.

Misty blushed at this remark. “Aw thank you, I really appreciate that Delia!” The gym leader would be lying if she said she hadn’t been enjoying her new dimensions. Although at first she was completely oblivious to her weight gain, she occasionally found herself playing with her newfound fat in private. She found a perverse enjoyment in watching her own body jiggle when she shook handfuls of fat.

“Now why don’t you head off to bed? It’s far too late for a growing girl like you to be up and about.” Delia smiled at the blubbery beauty. “I’ll have breakfast ready for you first thing in the morning.”

------

Delia lied. She lied straight to Misty’s face and she’d gotten away with it. ’Oh Delia, what have you gotten yourself into?’

Misty blushed harder when Delia's hands touched her belly.

A hint of a blush graced Delia's cheeks. But other than that, nothing. Delia continued to smile and rub. Did she even hear anything?

Like she was meant to be fat and pampered and loved. Pokemon Gyms? Responsibility? Tiresome, thankless busywork. No point in stressing over such things when someone as kind and caring as Delia offered a simpler, infinitely more enjoyable life. Just eat and bask in Delia's love. Eat and bask, eat and bask, day after day after day...

         Eventually they stopped. Neither of them needed to say anything; they just exchanged looks and wordlessly decided they'd done enough. Delia got off the bed, moved to Misty's side, and offered both hands. Misty took them and swung one meaty leg over the side, then the other. Both grunted with effort as they lifted Misty up and onto her feet. Misty lurched forward and nearly slammed Delia with her bulk. Fortunately, she found her footing just in time to avoid that.          "Good. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go get your post-breakfast snack ready." Delia pat Misty's doughy waist. "See you at the usual spot?"

Well, it might be a problem sooner or later... What I'm trying to say is...if I have any trouble getting um, y'know, dressed..." She looked into Delia's eyes, her expression asking the rest of the question for her.

         Delia smiled and squeezed Misty's shoulder. "Just holler and I'll be right there."

         With that, Delia walked out of the room. Misty watched her leave, gaze lingering on the door as it closed behind Delia. After a second, she giggled and hugged herself. What a wonderful woman.

         On her way to the dresser, Misty stopped at the full-length mirror mounted on the wall and regarded her reflection. Naturally, her eyes gravitated directly to her belly. Easily the biggest part of her, it hung down over her panties. Loved handles covered the straps clinging to her sides, so the only way to even tell she was wearing anything was to check the back. Mist was rubbed out of her eyes. Misty looked down upon the world beneath her. She was stood atop a peak so high, she could see what seemed like the entire world beneath, her breath taken by it’s beauty.

And a beautiful world it was, especially for someone with the gluttonous tendencies Misty now catered to. The sky was an eternal vibrant twilight dotted with clouds made from cotton candy. The rivers ran from a stream directly beneath her, flowing with chocolate of divine quality - silky smooth and savory unlike anything else. Dust and dirt were a thing of the past, instead replaced by rich chocolate cake. Even the flowing fields of grass which grew atop the ground was replaced by some sort of green candy, similar to liquorice in many aspects such as texture but had a tangy-sweet taste. The mountain she stood atop of was made wholly of rock candy, as all the mountains in this world were.

The coastline to her west was pure sugar, dotted with several patches of other candy sand such as Pixie Stix, and even in some places, Nerds. The ocean extended into the remaining purple-pink sunlight, consisting of what looked to be Cream Soda.

All foliage was replaced by different junk foods, with seemingly endless variety. Lollipop trees dotted the rolling hills, as well as pizza pines, bushes of ice cream, fried food trees of every kind, and the list goes on.

Gingerbread villages were nurtured within the valleys, hugging the meandering liquid chocolate.

“This is amazing!” Misty’s voice echoed across the land.

Misty was truly in her own heaven. The Endless flow of mead in Valhalla become its own realm, but in the golden drink’s stead, was the endless vastness of food.

Eager to explore this new dreamland, she leap into the chocolate spring before her, floating down the mountainside in the viscous paradise. The world flew around her as she accelerated towards the bottom, chocolate splashing into her mouth along the way. “This is the greatest thing I’ve ever tasted!” The rotund redhead cheered the whole way down. A pool of the chocolate was at the bottom, ready to cushion her fall.

*SPLASH*

When she reached the edge of the calm pool, she relaxed and rested her back against the cakey soil. She brought her mouth to the liquid she was now covered in; small delicate sips quickly developed into large mouthfuls. Her arm soon reached for the cake she was sat against, grabbing large chunks of the rich treat. She laid back, devouring cake and drinking chocolate as she pleased.

“I could get used to this…”

Beneath the surface of the pool, her chocolate covered body was completely nude, and her waistline was slowly expanding, though she cared too little to notice either of these things. The warm chocolate surrounding her was as relaxing as it was delicious. She was in bliss.

------

After several minutes of relaxing and gorging on cake and molten chocolate, the growing girl added an additional twenty-five pounds of weight to her frame. She leaned back and let loose a sigh of relief, one hand rubbing her fattened belly. “I just wish this dream would never end…”

She brought her head up and observed her surroundings. After thinking for a while on what to do next, Misty decided to…
141112111111121231.title: Enter Surrealia

choices: … live in the lap of luxury: She could be waited on by everyone in her manor.
… leave to explore more of what Surrealia had to offer.
1411121111111212311.content:
“Maybe it’s time to pay one of the villages a visit” Misty thought aloud. The nearest village sat only a few miles away. Though not far, she was not willing to traverse the distance on foot. Luckily for her, it also happened to run alongside the chocolate river.

Misty lifted her blubbery from from the bank she was firmly pressed against, not noticing the indent in the shape of her rear. Her extensive experience swimming would have proved useful to reduce travel time, but instead she opted to simply relax on her back and float downstream, letting the current take the brunt of the work needed to move her expansive mass.

Minutes passed on and the hefty redhead simply closed her eyes and relaxed. Mouthfuls of chocolate were occasionally taken from the river whenever she felt she had the room for it.

She always had room.

After around thirty minutes of drifting, her upper body stopped, but the momentum of her lower half spun her around. A slight tugging was felt in her hair, so she stood upright and freed the intrusion for inspection. It was a candy cane re-purposed as a fishing hook, with an old sleeping gingerbread man at the end of the line.

The elder began to spit and sputter in surprise, like an old plane engine revving up. “Bah! Oh- Ehem. Well now! What have we here?” A playful grin crossed his frosted lips. “Catch of the day I suppose, hmm?”

“Oh, hello sir!” Misty smiled sheepishly, believing herself to have caused the man trouble. “Sorry I got caught up in your line, wasn’t really paying attention.”

“Nonsense! You needn’t worry little one, or perhaps little wouldn’t be the appropriate word for you would it?” The old man gave a hearty chuckle once more. “Here, let me help you out.” The stranger helped lift Misty onto shore, but not without a battle; his back wouldn’t be forgiving him anytime soon. “Now, allow me to introduce myself.” He extended the nub of his gingerbread hand to Misty once more, meeting her grasp in the middle. “I’m Conchobar Berryseed, but the locals just call me Cocoa. You may call me the same if you wish.”

“I’m Misty, a pleasure to meet you sir!”

“Ah, the pleasure’s all mine… Come now, we mustn't keep the others waiting to meet you.” The gingerbread man walked her into town, showing her off to all the others. The place seemed like it had a magical charm cast over it. Gumdrop bushes grew vibrantly along the streets, the townsfolk were the kindest she’d ever met, and the food was simply divine!

After reaching the center of town, she was sat down at a gingerbread table fit for a dining-hall—it was packed with samples of all sorts that the gingerpeople had in store: Cakes, cookies, eclairs, pies, and more waited to be emptied into the growing girl’s bare gut. She took only a short break before digging in.

They were the greatest deserts she’d ever tasted. The cakes were rich and dense; the cookies melted in her mouth; the eclairs were to die for; and the pies were sweeter than candy, (and much more fattening too). The bountiful deserts were almost endless. To wash it all down, she was provided with pitchers of the warm chocolate.

A large belch was released once the feast was over, and Misty sat back and began rubbing her distended belly. After that massive meal, another 30 lbs were added to her frame. A rather attractively cut-out figure made her way towards the naked mass of Misty’s body, which was still covered in chocolate as well the remnants of her banquet. “You must be the Misty I’ve been hearing so much about!” the young woman declared, her voice as sweet as the pie the gym leader had just eaten. “I just had to stop by and meet you for myself. I’m Nutmeg, the Mayor here in Sweetbrook!” The two exchanged the traditional formalities one is expected of when meeting someone new. They soon came to the topic of how Misty got here. Even though Misty told them this was all part of a dream, they seemed to care not, declaring her arrival as prophesied many ages ago by the great Obesseus.

“By the power vested in me by The Abundant One, I declare Misty to be royalty here in Sweetbrook, and across all of Surrealia at that!” Nutmeg lightly tapped Misty on both shoulders with a candy cane sword, and in a wave the gingerbread people began to kneel. “She will be provided a property of her own here, in the Gingerbread Manor. Our people are here to serve you, your majesty.” Nutmeg soon found herself kneeling before Misty’s blubbery body.

’Wow…’ Misty thought to herself. ’I can have whatever I want?’

Considering this for a moment, Misty decided to…

14511.content:
Her line went taut. “Yes, come to mama.” She quickly stuffed the last of her candy bar into her mouth before grabbing the rod. The pole bent and bowed as she pulled with all her might. “Wow, it is a big one.” She grunted as she put all her weight into it. With a mighty tug, her quarry finally flew from the water as Misty stumbled back onto her cushy rear with a loud thud.

Her eyebrows shot up in confusion as a young boy landed beside her with a crash. He coughed and sputtered, clutching something small to his chest. Her eyes widened as she watched the pokemon seemed to only wince.

“Hey, are you two okay?”

“Yeah, I am fine.” He grimaced as he sat up. His eyes grew to the size of saucers as he took in his savior.

“What about your pokemon?”

He looked down at Pikachu, worriedly. He was about to reply when a faint squawk reached his ear, followed by another and another. The terror in the pit of his stomach, grew and grew as the squawking became louder and more numerous.

“That is a lot of Sperrow, I wonder who got them all worked up.” Misty hummed as she gazed over the lake. Ash shot to his feet and started running.

“Hey, where are you going?” She asked as she watched him race to her bike. “Hey! That is my bike!”

“I am sorry but I need to get him to a pokemon center, I will bring it back, I promise!” He shouted as he stuffed Pikachu into the basket and paddled in a mad dash.

~~~~~~~

“You!” Ash jumped as a very angry Misty waddled in. Ash stumbled back, his back hitting the counter as she stalked forward. “You completely destroyed my bike!” Her chest heaved as she let the twisted, smoking heap of metal fall to the floor.

“Ah! I am sorry I trashed your bike. I need to get my pokemon to the pokemon center. I will pay you back, even if it takes me years.”

“Oh, you better believe you will!” She glared.

“But I can’t do anything about that until I make sure Pikachu is okay.” He glanced sadly toward the door leading back to the operating room.

Misty followed his gaze before her eyes softened. “How is he?”

“Not good, Nurse Joy says he pushed himself well beyond his limits fighting off those Sperrows.” Ash replied before turning back to her, his eyes widened in panic as she was hunched over, bracing her hands on her knees. “Are you alright?” He asked as he rushed to her side.

“Yeah, just fine. Do you know how many calories I burned running after you, Jerk.” She growled before slapping his hand away. She glanced at the vending machines around the lobby before patting her pockets. A large sigh escaped her lips as her shoulders sagged. “I am going to head to the cafeteria to grab something to eat, DON’T go anywhere.”

He blinked as she stormed off, a blush dusted his cheeks as his gaze drifted down to the butt and hips. Tearing his eyes away, his mother’s frowning face appeared before her mind's eye. It pointed at the retreating redhead sternly.

“Hey, wait! Let me treat you to dinner at least!” He shouted as he ran after her. Misty stopped, turning to face him with a critical glare.

“You want to buy me dinner?”

“Yeah, it is the least I can do after stealing your bike.” He broke eye contact sheepishly.

“I don’t know if you have the funds to fill me up.” She states smugly, giving her round belly a slap. It jiggled and bounced like jello for far longer than Ash thought it would. Misty bit her lip as he continued to stare. She stuck out her belly, making it look as big as possible. “I am a pretty fat girl, I can eat a lot.”

Finally tearing his eyes away from her large, doughy belly, meet her forest green eyes. “That makes sense, a buffet maybe?” He asked. Instead of getting angry, Misty’s eyes seemed to light up as she absently rubbed her belly.

“Hmm, I will take you up on your offer but not tonight. Pikachu comes first.” She grinned as she spun back around, waltzing into the cafeteria with a new bounce in her step. Ash followed her as the two got in line. An assistance nurse stood behind the counter, her smile became strained at the sight of Misty.

“Welcome back, the standard plate then, or will you be getting extra portions?”

“Just the normal plate.” Misty grumbled. The nurse handed her a simple tray with a bowl of cheese pasta, a dinner roll, a small side salad as well as a drink. The nurse handed Ash the same thing as she shot him a sympathetic look.

“What do I owe you for the meals?” He said as he reached for his wallet.

“Nothing, meals are free for trainers unless you are getting seconds.”

He blinked at her in surprise. “Wow, that is pretty cool. Does that include food for Pokemon as well?”

“Yes sir.”

Ash smiled all the way back to the table only to find Misty’s plate completely empty.

“Wow.”

“Like I said I am a pretty fat girl.” She sighed before taking a sip of her drink. “You are just starting your pokemon journey, right?”

“Yep, Pikachu is my starter. Though that hasn’t turned out so great for him so far.” He said with a frown.

“You are just starting out, mistakes happen. It is what you do next and how you learn from them that matters.” Misty said softly, shooting him a soft smile. Ash couldn’t help but smile back.

“Sounds like something my mom would say and she is one of the smartest people know.”

“Well get used to it because you aren’t getting rid of me til you have paid me back for the bike. You did say something along the lines of ``even if it takes years.”

“I did say that, didn’t I.” Ash mumbled. “I guess we are traveling partners then.”

“Yep,” She said, shaking her head at his stupid grin. “If we are going to be traveling together there is some stuff you have to know. One, I am fat and I like it. I know it is weird but it is just something I am into so deal with it. Two, with the way I eat, I am going to get bigger and I am okay with that. And three, one of my goals is to be the biggest water type trainers around.”

Ash only blinked for a moment as he looked down to her belly and then back to her face. “That is a little weird I guess. But mom says beauty comes in all shapes and sizes and who the person is is more important than how they appear.”

“Your mom sounds very smart, mama’s boy.” She chuckled as he nearly choked on his drink.

“Hey, I am not!” He growled. She only raised an eyebrow in response. After a moment of raining in his temper and calming down a question popped into his head. “If you are trying to get fatter, why do you ride a bike?”

A blush crept across her cheeks. “I may want to get bigger but I also want to be a water pokemon master which means I need to catch water pokemon. The bike made traveling to different lakes and rivers easier. It sucks but it is a short term loss for a long term gain.”

“So what if instead of buying you a new bike, what if I just buy you food instead. Help with your goals, because I intend to take on the Gym Challenge so going places to catch new pokemon is going to happen.”

Misty thought for a moment before a smile spread across her face. “I think I can live with that.” She stretched her hand out. “Misty.”

He looked at her for a moment before returning the gesture. “Ash.”

145212.content:
Ash was a little nervous. He had already gone through the entirety of the Sinnoh League, him and his trusty Pikachu. With the use of the little electric mouse Pokemon special powers they were able to make it all the way to the semi-finals of the Lily of the Valley Conference. Although he didn't make it, he wasn’t deterred in his mission to become a Pokemon Master in the slightest. The first thing he did when he got home was look for more challenges to better himself and his Pokemon. That’s when Brock told him about Misty.

Although he already beat the Cerulean City Gym all those years ago, he figured that it would be best to revisit old ground. Maybe Ash could learn something new from the experience. Misty was said to be a pretty powerful gym leader, much more so than her sisters. Although she was only a handful of years older than him, she had already earned her reputation as a talented Water Type Pokemon enthusiast. But regarding her other talents, others suddenly became vague in their description of her. ‘You have to see her to believe her’ was the common theme of conversation. That and a rather rude nickname ‘The Beached Wailord’.

Ash wish he knew more about Misty before battling her, but it was of no big loss to him. The only real thing that he should be focusing on is her Pokemon and what tactics he would have to use to beat her. With what he learned in the Sinnoh Region, he was more than eager to put away any personal questions about her. When Ash entered the Gym, he was led to the main fighting area, a large swimming pool, and immediately saw perhaps the largest women he had ever seen in his life. It was Misty, reclining at the end of the pool. He was so taken aback by her size that he almost forgot to respond to her.

Misty was absolutely enormous, wearing nothing but a blue, one piece bathing suit that was stretched so tight across her frame it looked as if it was painted on. Her belly jutted out far in front of her, her face, which was adorned with humongous cheeks coated in freshly-grown dimples, beaming so brightly that it almost had Ash feel like he needed to put on a pair of shades. Evan her puffy arms looked like they were as wide as his torso, and although he could not see it, Ash couldn't help but think about how huge that Misty's bottom should be along with the rest of her.

Whilst Ash busied himself by fretting over his chances of victory, his opponent was more than pleased with the young man standing at the opposite end of her pool. Misty continued to look the young man up and down with some consideration. She liked what she saw. He was pretty scrawny, at least when compared to someone like herself, but really, the majority of people she knew were scrawny compared to her. She had never really thought about dating anyone before, but maybe she could have fun with a boy like this, if he was so willing to indulge her 'appetite'.

As Misty’s Politoed and Ash’s Torterra combated one another, Ash made the valiant effort to not look for too long at Misty and focus on the fight at hand. But try as he might, it proved very difficult to ignore her, especially with how she made teasing glances in his general direction. She would rub her belly in ways he supposed were meant to be sensual and she also continued to slap herself all over to make herself wobble too. Ash blushed despite himself. As Torterra collapsed against the strength of the Politoed, Ash shook himself out of his confusion to take in the surroundings. To his horror, is Pokemon had been defeated.

Torterra should have one that fight, and it would had it not been for it’s trainer’s lack of attention. "Uh oh! It looks like you were a little too...absent," Misty laughed, making her belly bounce up and down in the chlorinated water. "And your Pokemon ended up being beaten, poor thing! I certainly hope that wasn't the only one you brought besides that Pikachu!

"O-Of course I do, but I'll send out Pikachu next!"

“Excellent, but...what do you say to a bit of a wager?” Misty asked, continuing to rub her belly over and over, eliciting a hot flush to come over Ash’s face. “To make things a tad bit more entertaining, you know?”


“A...a wager? L-like a bet?” Ash echoed, trying hard not to get flustered, but failing rather miserably.

“Yep, unless your too scared to gamble! How about this: If I win, you have to make it up to me for wasting my time! I was busy having a relaxing soak before you came along!” Misty gave off a faux annoyed smirk. “If you lose to me, your gonna treat me to a trip to the Cerulean City Buffet. How does that sound?

Ash gulped. This gave him all the more reason not to end up losing here. He didn’t think that battling the Cerulean Gym again would be so...different this time around. He quickly withdrew his fainted Torterra, and Pikachu hopped down from his shoulder. Misty just licked her lips in anticipation and spanked her gut, she wasn't intimidated of some over sized lightning rat either. As the battle commenced, her Politoed soon fell, but Misty still had two more of her Pokemon she was ready to unleash. Next up was Togetic.

An hour went by, and at the end of it Ash had lost. All of his six Pokemon had fainted to Misty’s. The enormous Wailord of a women cheered out loud. She rubbed her belly a few more times, smacking her lips as she thought, excitedly, of the dinner that she and this handsome young trainer would get to have together. Looking over at Ash, he could see he appeared rather sad, but since Misty didn't want others to think her a bad person, she did what she could to lift his spirits up a tad.

"If it makes you feel any better, I won't ask you to pay for me. Trust me, it wouldn't do any good to an up and coming trainer's wallet if I made them have to buy a meal for me. It'd leave your wallet empty and your family in debt."

"Uh...well...thanks..."

“Hey, don’t be a Debbie Downer on me here!” Misty got up from the pool, albeit rather slowly, and waddled her way over to Ash on the other side, close enough to him that her belly bumped against him, almost sending him falling down backwards. “You know, you’re a very lucky guy, getting the chance to spend the night with me! I'm a pretty big thing here in Cerulean City, both in the literal and figurative sense!"

Ash was about to ask Misty if she was so famous, how come he had never heard of her before, but couldn't get a word in as the obese redhead led him out of the fighting arena and gym onto the lively streets of Cerulean City.

14533211.content:
It was a pleasant, sunny day on Route 1, and Misty was relaxing along the edge of a small creek, having gotten some fishing done a little while earlier. She had been away from her home in Cerulean City for some time now, having left to escape the ridicule of her older sisters, who mercilessly ribbed her over her chubby figure and lack of physical development. Of course, her skills as a Pokemon Trainer were far superior, but the girls were far too shallow to notice or care. Misty, being the vindictive little girl she was, decided when she left that she would not only strive to become the greatest Water-type trainer around, but to get as fat as possible, just to screw with her sisters.

The former goal was still in the works, but the latter...had succeeded almost too well; through means unknown even to her, she'd managed reach a weight in excess of 10,000 lbs., just through simple eating. Even stranger, she had somehow also grown proportionally in height, keeping her from being rendered immobile and making her a bit larger than the average house. In spite of all this strangeness, though, Misty didn't freak out or anything; no, she was the type to just roll with things and go on with her life.

At the moment, the huge girl was sunning herself on the bank of the river, without a care in the world. So calm was she that she'd decided to remove her clothes to aid in her tanning, feeling confident that if any interlopers came along, she'd easily be able to frighten them off with her size. All seemed well...at least until a loud scream from the woods jolted her out of her reverie. Slowly lifting herself off the ground, she tried to cover up and looked back and forth in search of the source of the sound. However, the source ended up finding her, as evidenced by the odd feeling of something ramming into her flabby rear.

"Huh? W-Who's down there?" Reaching past her numerous rolls of fat, Misty pulled out a young boy, seemingly around her age, dressed in red and white trainer's clothes and wearing a Pokemon League cap. He wasn't alone, as an injured-looking Pikachu was clutched in his arms. Setting the two down, Misty carefully looked them over, concerned for their safety. Before she could gather much information, though, the boy quickly bolted back up, grabbed his Pokemon, and ran off into the woods, mumbling, "Sorry for bumping into you, Miss!".

"Hm...that was weird," Misty wondered out loud. "What the heck was that guy running from?" The answer soon came, though, in the form of a huge flock of angry Spearows flying over the trees.

"...That's not good."

----
(A/N: Okay, I know that wasn't so great. >> If anything, though, it should serve as a good foundation for things to come.)

"Ah, jeez go away!" The fat water trainer shouted as she then began to run away, which by doing so squashed and scared any unfortunate Spearows in front of her. Misty then, due to larger status quickly caught up with the spiky haired boy she had seen just a while ago. Seeing the boy being attacked by the birds she reached into one of the various folds on her giant belly and pulled out her various bags, her food bags, her bag full of customized clothes, and her pokeball and item bag. Quickly getting out a pokeball she threw it into the and out popped out a Pokemon. "Come on Staryu!", the bare naked trainer said as her flabby arm jiggled from the simple act of throwing. "Hiyaaaa!" the orange starfish creature yelped as it flew through the air. "Quick, Staryu blast those Spearows away and protect that boy!" Staryu then landed on the now wet ground as it had began to rain quite violently and storm clouds could be seen overhead. Staryu then blasted out a jet of pressurized water from it's top arm blowing away a few of the birds away from the boy and his injured Pikachu. "Alright!" Misty smirked as she saw the Spearow backing off a bit. But, unfortunately all was for naught as moments later About twenty or so Spearow charged at her Staryu, actually breaking apart one of it's arms. ( They grow back don't worry.) "On no, Staryu return!" Misty said as she called back the hurt and damaged star Pokemon back to it's ball. Seeing who the Staryu belonged to, the Spearows then charged at her with far more of them then the last that attacked her earlier. "Agggh stop!" Misty cried out as the birds pecked and dived at her head and arms actually cutting through her from just repeated scratches. Misty hunched down as much as her body would allow and tried to protect herself from further attacks, which wasn't of much success due to her girth.

Misty then looked up only to find a Spearow charging straight towards her eyes! "Ahhhhh!" Misty yelped, closing her eyes in fear of the horrible pain she was about to feel. But, strangely it never came, the flab filled redhead opened her eyes to see the black haired boy on top of who had apparently punched the bird out the way before it stroke her. "Hey, I don't know who you are, but I've screwed up a lot today and dammit if I'm gonna allow someone who tried to help me get hurt from my mistakes.", the boy said with a stern, serious looking face, saying this as rain poured onto his face and down on his black hair, with well over fifty Spearow charging at him. " You hear me Spearow? I'm not afraid of you, I'm gonna become the world's greatest Pokemon trainer! So do your worst!" the boy said as lighting and thunder roared around him. "Oh my.", Misty said as she both was flushed by the boy's words directed to her and admiring his courage despite the immediate danger. As the boy swallowed, getting ready for the onslaught that awaited him, suddenly a yellow blur jumped past his outstretched arms. Just moments ago Pikachu, seeing his new trainer acting so bold and caring towards his well being despite how he had treated the kid only some minutes ago filled him with an urge to help him, to help the girl who had tried to save both of them. Getting up from the muddy ground, he quickly lept up, bounded off the girl's jiggly gut, then leaped off the boy's shoulder and let out the strongest electric attack he could muster in his current state. By sheer luck, a bolt of lighting came down from the massive, dark storm clouds and struck him the moment he unleashed his attack.

"Pi.....kaaaa......chuuuuu!!!!!" The little mouse shouted as his body was shot by the lighting bolt, amplifying his attack by well over fifty times its normal power. Out of the electric Pokemon came a huge blast of lighting, instantly killing thirty or so Spearow that had gotten caught in the blast. The twenty left, who had by extreme luck had not been touched by the main part of the blast, but due to its surrounding energy had been greatly wounded and flew away in a panic. Due to the light from the blast and the sound of it, the two children had fallen unconscious along with Pikachu himself.

About a few minutes later, Misty awoke to find the sky had cleared up and a rainbow was above them. "Just how did that work?", Misty wondered out loud, touching her hand to her first blubbery chin. "Wondering just why the lighting bolt had worked in Pikachu's favor. As she continued her thoughts, the boy ad the Pikachu came to. "Uhh nggh Pi..Pikachu we did it buddy." the boy said meekly,his eyes half open still worn out from it all. The spiky haired boy slowly got up and and saw the massive girl in front of him. "Wahhh!, he screamed finally the nature of her truly sinking into his mind. "Hey, don't be like that towards me I just helped you earlier!", Misty said putting her hands on her massive, bulging hips making her body sway a bit. "Ah so...sorry I've just never met a girl so fat before... ah ohhhh...", the boy said as his voice trailed off strangely. "Hey! What are you looking at..awwhhhh..." Misty said as she looked behind her seeeing what had made the boy so awestruck, flying through the rainbow was a large oddly colored bird Pokemon, one that looked like none the two kids had ever seen before." "What kind of Pokemon is that?" the boy asked to no one in particular. In response however the boy's pokedex chimed in and spoke. "There are still many Pokemon that have yet to have been discovered." In an odd way somewhat answering the question.

As the boy looked in awe at the Pokemon flying away, he then realized how is new Pikachu was. "Oh hang on Pikachu I'll get you to safety soon!" The boy then hurried off to the city ahead, Viridian City. Turning back the boy called out to the huge, fat, naked girl. "Hey, thank you for helping me, I hope we see each other again!" Hearing this Misty shouted, "Hey wait!", but it was too late the boy was too far to hear her. "Oh, I didn't even get his name." Misty said blushing as she remembered his brave words. But then she smelled an odd scent, looking over she saw the burnt, charred remains of her bags of delicious foods and her customized, specifically made for her size, clothes from her wealthy parents.

Overcoming with rage and despair, the first thought in the redhead's mind was anger towards the boy, who she for some reason saw as the perpetrator to this awful event, seeing it as intentional on his part. "Argghhh, That boy... he's gonna pay for what he did to my food!" Misty said as ran off to the city in a fit of rage as her big, flabby body bounced and jiggled all over.

What happens now?
145332112.title: Misty's no bird hunter.

choices: Option A Dosent Sound TOO Bad...
1453321122.content:
If Ash had learned one thing from my master during his Pokemon researcher apprenticeship at Professor Oak's Laboratory, it was when he told him this: “If you hear the sound of a thunderclap under a clear sky, don’t be too quick to rush for an umbrella”. Professor Oak always hated clear skies; when the sky was static and blue was when the world dropped its guard. No one prepared for adversity when the sun shined above them and when they were content. It was only in the grasp of a rolling storm did anyone give a damn about making a plan.

The day it made sense occurred under a clear sky like so many others, while Ash was running towards the Pokemon center to get his Pikachu cared for. he had already experienced an attack by a flock of Spearow, but he was sure that nothing else wrong would occur to him that day.

Oh how wrong he was.

Ash and Pikachu were taking a break from running, the Pokemon center was a lot farther away than they thought, and Pikachu himself wasn't that hurt, just tired from using all his energy. Ash took a long deep breath of the air and exhaled softly,enjoying the woodsy air, helping him rejuvenate and get his wind back together. Pikachu was laying against a tree stump, trying to catch his energy back too. Before they could truly have a moment to relax, however, something like a thunderclap was heard a couple miles away from them.

“Must be a storm coming” mused Ash. “‘Bout time, too. This forest looks like it hasn't seen a good rain in years.”

However, It wasn't a storm at all, but instead something possibly far more dangerous. It was the sound of a Tree being snapped in two by Misty's barreling form as she ran to catch up with the trainer and Pokemon who ruined her food.

Suddenly, the ground beneath Ash and Pikachu's feet started to tremble. It started off slight at first, but increased in power over time. The sound of thundering footsteps were starting to become more and more apparent. Ash and Pikachu looked to each other, unsure of what to do. "Chu?".

Just as the mouse Pokemon said this, a loud booming voice was heard and a large shadow engulfed the are in which they were resting. "Hey! You! You got some nerve you little brat!" Ash and Pikachu looked up to see Misty's form looming over them, and she looked mad, as mad as an ursaring who had her teddiursa stolen from her. (Which wasn't very far of).

"Oh! Hi there, miss." Ash waived his hand cheerily, completely not getting it past his thick skull that she was mad at them. Pikachu followed suit. "What arer you doing out here?"

"Don't give me that!" Misty scolded. "You know exactly why I'm here!"

"We Do?"

"YES!"

"But...what? Did you come all the way here to thank us for saving you from those spearow? You don't-"

"That's the problem!" Misty seethed, "While you were playing hero, you're Pikachu electrocuted my food! It's Ruined! You two are gonna pay for that, and in case you don't want to not spend the night under me, I suggest you cough up!"

"Hey! Don't blame Pikachu for burning your stuff! He was trying to save us and now he doesn't have any more energy!"

"Does it look lie I care?!"

Ash turned back to Pikachu, who was visabley terrified by the fat teenager that was yelling at them. She was a lot bigger then him, much less just Ash, to the point she towered over even the trees. She didn't seem to be hurt by the electrical surge he gave out earlier, most likely it was absorbed by her fat, so he doubted that even if he had his powers back, they wouldn't do anything.

Ash sighed and turned back to the looming Misty. "How much do we owe you?" he said reluctantly.

"500,000 Poke."

"What! Half a million for food!? That's more than my mom makes in a year!"

Misty chuckled darkly, It was clear she wasn't going to let this punk get away with what he did, whether he saved her or not. “Well... you are just going to have to repay me some other way then. You can pick option A: Let me travel along with you until you get enough money to repay for your damages. Or you can pick option B.

"Wh...what's option B."

"That's a surprise." Misty cooed. "Now choose or I'll chose for you!"

Leaf was teleported into space so Misty could congratulate her.
14533222212212.content:
Twelve year old Leaf idolized Misty, the massive deity that she lived on. She desired to be as fat as her, envious of having so many rolls, one of which even housed Leaf's entire home town. Leaf even took the time to build a huge balance scale. She would release her Snorlax on one end, and then sit herself on the other end and then binge on food, hoping to feel the scale begin to tilt. Unfortunately for Leaf, she was still only 400 pounds, which is still no where near the weight of her Snorlax, let alone her idol. But Leaf's dedication would catch the attention of the paragon. Misty wanted a companion to share her size with, and Leaf would love nothing more than that.

One day soon after Misty had taken interest in making Leaf her immeasurably obese companion, Leaf had went to the balance scale she had built in order to partake in what was now part of her daily routine. Once Leaf had climbed up into one of the pans, she saw an envelope in the center that had a stamp with a Snorlax as the picture. She waddled over to pick it up, and saw that there was no return address on it at all. Leaf opened the envelope and read the contents to herself.

-------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------



"Dear Leaf,

You decidedly have been deliberately fattening yourself for a long time now, dreaming of becoming as fat as Misty herself. But I want you to think carefully about if that is what you truly want. There would be no going back once your weight makes the scale tilt. If you are certain that you want to be the very fattest, like no one ever was, then swallow the pill in this envelope."

-------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------



Inside the envelope, there was a round pink pill just like the letter had stated. After a few minutes of thinking things through, Leaf decided that she wants to be as fat as possible more than anything else. With conviction, Leaf swallowed the pill. At first, nothing happened. After waiting for several minutes, Leaf began to believe that she was deceived. Leaf began eating the feast she had prepared for her daily binge, thinking that she would just have to keep making herself fatter the old-fashioned way.

After Leaf finished eating the enormous meal, she laid on her back in the scale's pan, groaning due to the pain from her immensely stuffed belly. But soon, the pains suddenly stopped; Leaf's belly began rumbling, as if she were still hungry after eating an entire feast by herself. Confused, Leaf reached for some of the remaining food scraps to satisfy her gut, but then her arm started rumbling too, quickly followed by the rest of her flabby body.

All of Leaf's flesh started expanding outwards. Leaf's already massive gut continued to grow, her taut belly loosening, flowing into soft rolls. Leaf's cheeks became rounder, appearing as if she were storing two oranges in the sides of her mouth. More chins formed on Leaf's neck, and her limbs all grew much thicker. Leaf's behind had also grown incredibly wide, covering up most of the pan she was sitting in. Leaf was now a fatty blob, and she was excited at her new shape, but that was not the last pleasant surprise that she received. Once Leaf's growth had stopped, she then began to feel as if she were descending. She looked over to the other side of the scale, and saw that the pan with her Snorlax was rising upwards. Leaf was now fatter than a Snorlax, and when she had realized this, she was happier than she had ever been before in her entire life.

Despite how happy Leaf was that her dream suddenly felt much closer, an issue arose. Leaf had become immobile due to how fat she was. But Leaf didn't concern herself with that, as she was still in ecstacy over how amazing her own body was. Eventually though, Leaf was forced to acknowledge that being completely incapable of moving could cause problems. While it gave Leaf an excuse to not strain her massive frame, it also meant that she would not be capable of getting food on her own. Although, Leaf had proven to Misty that she was truly certain that she wanted to become an immeasurably fatty spacial mass. Because of this, Misty herself intervened.

10 years ago...

A girl was born named Misty Waterflower. When she was born, she weighed 75 pounds. Obviously, she was a C-section. Over her childhood, Misty ate a lot of food, usually enough to feed 20 people for a year as a snack! And as she ate, she grew, and grew, and grew, and grew...


- - -The Present- - -

"Mmm, that ought to tide me over until my twenty-fifth snack for the day." Misty said, having just run an ice cream parlor out of business. To say she was huge would be an understatement, she was ENORMOUS! At 1,000,000 pounds, she was truly a gluttonous colossus. Her big fat face rested upon over a hundred chins, breasts that were each as large as a mini-van, and a belly that defied description. Her arms and legs were giant pillows of fat that completely engulfed her hands and feet. At this point she shouldn't be able to move at all, but she found that by shaking her fat in a special way, she could 'ooze' along the ground like the blob, which is basically what she was now.

Suddenly, Misty's belly rumbled. "Hmm, I guess that didn't tide me over. Time for more!" Misty said, oozing her way into yet another restaurant. Usually restaurants expected to see the fat behemoth, but the unlucky few who don't instantly go out of business, like the ice cream parlor from earlier. Once she finally got the entirety of her ooze-like body through the doors, she made her standard order: at least 10 of everything on the menu. (which includes healthy stuff. She has to stay regular after all.) The workers placed some of her order on her fat, which Misty then proceeded to shake in such a way that it was brought up to her hungry mouth. This continued for a long time, until...
1453322222.title: Million Misty

choices: Team Rocket Make a Surprise Visit!
14533222221.content:
Ash Ketchum was fairly new to the Pokémon Training scene. The ten-year-old from Pallet Town feeling rather confident of his Pokémon’s abilities after earning the Boulder Badge in Pewter City, so he hurriedly made his way towards Cerulean City to earn the Cascade Badge. The Rock Type Gym Leader, Brock, gave the aspiring boy a word of advice regarding the water type gym leader, Misty.

“She has what you would call...a very large personality.” Brock tiptoed around the more obvious qualities about Misty. “She’s incredibly famous in Cerulean, but a lot of visitors can be overwhelmed by her. Just try to keep an open mind, and maybe you’ll see why she is the City’s favorite daughter.” Ash was thankful for the information but wished that he was more specific. Nevertheless, he made his way to the port city in breakneck speed.

Once he had finally made it to Cerulean City, he instantly set out to find the Water Type Gym. His Pokémon was tough, and he trusted in their abilities. With his trusty Pikachu at his side, he made his way inside the coveted building to challenge the gym leader, Misty...only to find that she wasn't there. Determined, Ash asked around to see where he might find her, and to his confusion, they kept recommending various eateries and restaurants around the city. It culminated in a goose chase of where she had been throughout the day.

Ash made it eventually to an Ice Cream Parlor, where he found a poor man in chef’s outfit sitting outside the front door, sobbing. “H-hey mister, what’s wrong?” Ash asked, never liking having to see other people despair.

“Oh, it was terrible, just terrible!” The man cried out. “I’ve heard rumors about her, but I never thought she would be THAT big! She ate everything, all of it!”

“Who did?” Ash asked, suddenly feeling a bit of anger rise in him. “Don’t worry mister, I’ll find the Pokémon who did this and make them pay!”

“Po...Pokemon?” The chef quelled his sobs for a moment to look up at the inquisitive ten-year-old. “Oh, oh you poor fool. You must be new here like me.” The man shook his head and stood up from his seat on the ground. “Go to the restaurant on Cobalt Street, and you’ll find the monster that did this.”

Ash was puzzled but did what the Ice Cream man suggested. As he made his way to Cobalt Street, his ears were suddenly subjugated to various sounds of burping, lip smacking, and moans of pleasure. He followed the sound to the only restaurant on the street, where he found that the entrance was blocked by...some sort of thing. It bulged out from the doorframe like a pinkish white mass of something. No one on the street was surprisingly unfazed by the sounds of the mass, which only made Ash more and more confused. What was going on?

The mass that bulged out from the door was slightly spherical, and when Ash went to touch it he found it incredibly warm and even soft. It was covered it some sort of watery substance, and no matter how much pressure he put into it, It had no resistance and devoured his arm all the way to his shoulder, giving his Pikachu the chance to do the same. Feeling bold, he decided to worm his way inside of the restaurant no matter the cost, so he shimmied his way through space where the mass touched the doorframe. After a couple of minutes of fumbling around the blobby thing and having a hard time breathing, he finally made it out into the open space of the restaurant.

That’s when Ash and Pikachu saw Misty.

At first, Ash couldn't believe what he was seeing, naively believing that it was some sort of undiscovered Pokemon, but there was, in fact, a human face all the way up there. From his perspective, she looked to be around the size of a passenger airplane, and even though the restaurant was incredibly spacious and large, her body fat took up almost all of it, only leaving space for the entrance to the kitchen and a few casual diners in the back. It then dawned on Ash that all that stuff he had been swimming around in earlier was pure blubber, her blubber. She was the one making all the sound, endlessly eating and eating and eating nonstop without a pause to breathe. He didn't know what to make of any of it, but then he remembered what Brock had told in back in Pewter City. While he didn’t understand how someone like her could even exist, he tried to keep an open mind and decided to be cordial with her.

“Excuse me, Misses Misty, ma’am?” Ash spoke up, trying to greet the gluttonous redhead currently eating enough to make a Snorlax uncomfortable.

“Hmph?” Misty stopped her monumental feast as he heard someone call her name. She looked down past her many chins and automobile-sized cleavage to see a little boy by her belly. “Oh, hello there! You must be the one that was playing around with my butt earlier!”

Ash blushed as he realized that what he and his Pikachu were testingly feeling earlier was, in fact, her expansive backside. “O-oh, I’m so very sorry Ma’am, I didn't know that-!”

“Hm? What’s there to be sorry about? People grope my fat all the time.” Misty interrupted Ash’s apology with an amused girly chuckle before taking the time to shove a week’s worth of pizza into her gluttonous maw. “Is there something you wanted to talk to me about?”

“Uh…” Ash shook his head to get his thoughts straight. He couldn't get sidetracked, not after running all over town looking for the elusive gym leader. “My name is Ash Ketchum, and I’m here to challenge you to a Gym Battle!”

“...A gym battle?” Misty echoed, the words feeling alien to her. “Oh yeah, that’s right! I’m a Gym Leader! Totally forgot about that.”

“You...you forgot?” Ash looked positively dumbfounded. “H-how is that possible!? Don’t you have to fight trainers when they come to your gym to get the Cascade Badge?”

“Nope, not at all!” Misty smiled as she guzzled down gallons upon gallons of soda as she spoke. “Trainers like you tend to skip me and just go to Vermillion City, I haven’t had a Gym Battle in years or a Pokemon Battle for that matter.”

“What...but...why?” Ash didn't understand the words that were coming out of Misty’s mouth. A Pokemon Gym Leader...who didn't battle at all? The gigantic blob of a human gave the dumbfounded boy a smirk.

“Some people like to battle Pokemon, some people like to travel around the region forging bonds, but me? I want to eat and get fat, shocking I know.” Misty chuckled sarcastically, wobbling her fat from side to side and making the building itself shake violently. “I get unlimited funding from the league, so I can eat as much as I want whenever I want, but Pokemon Battles take away from my precious time to do that. I made it so only the desperate or the stupid would ever challenge me by putting up a fee to fight me, and if you lose you gotta pay.”

“A fee? That doesn't sound too bad…” Ash breathed a sigh of relief.

“A Million Pokedollars doesn't sound too bad?” Misty giggled mischievously, to which Ash dropped his jaw almost all the way to the floor. “Gym Leaders have full control over what they do with their gyms, so a billion dollars is the price I put up. Nowadays I just like to eat and feel around my fat. So...you still want to fight me?”

Ash felt incredibly overwhelmed. He was confident in his Pokemon's abilities as fighters...but he didn't have a billion Pokedollars! What would happen if he lost, would he just have to skip the Cascade Badge and move onto the next city? Ash shook himself of these doubts, too determined to let a blob of fat get in the way of his dreams of becoming a Pokemon Master. With a steely look in his eyes, he puffed out his chest and put his fist to it. "I came here for a Pokemon Battle, And I'm not leaving until I get one!"

Misty giggled at the display of boldness from the little boy in front of her. "Have it your way then, I guess I could skip this snack for now. Follow me back to the gym, I'll give you your fight~" The redheaded blob gave Ash a wink before she wiggled her fat out from the Restaurant, and Ash found himself having to run to keep up with her surprisingly fast mobility.
14533222221.title: A young boy walks into the restaurant

choices: "...Can you stay in Cerulean a lil' longer?"
145332222211.content:
Ash followed Misty out of the restaurant onto Cobalt Street as she made her way to her own Pokemon Gym. In the open and no longer within the confines of the spacious building, Ash and Pikachu could take in her body in all of its enormity. It took up pretty much the entity of the street, her gelatinous adipose oozing along the asphalt road and spilling along into the concrete sidewalk, smothering any car that was foolish enough to park in her path and hip checking random pedestrians. To the ten-year old’s surprise, nobody paid the enormous gym leader any mind. They got out of her way to make sure they won't be crushed underneath her, but other than that her sight was a daily occurrence.

Suddenly, the Earth underneath Ash’s feet shook and trembled, sending him off balance and almost making him stumble to the ground. At first, he thought it was an Earthquake, but the tremors were soon followed by a very loud and wet gurgle emanating from Misty’s stomach. She patted it affectionately like it was some sort of a pet. “I hope we can get this over with soon, that snack I had won’t tide me over forever.”

“Snack?!” Ash exclaimed, not believing that the amount of food he saw Misty shoveling into her greedy maw earlier could be considered a ‘snack’ by anyone. “H-how can you still be hungry?! You just ate enough food to feed a Snorlax for a year in one sitting!”

“It’s just the kind of gal I am, I guess.” Misty shrugged her flabby shoulder casually, unfazed by Ash’s surprised reaction. “Ever since I was born, I don’t think I’ve ever NOT been hungry. I eat and eat, but I can still fit more food in this big old gut of mine!” She slapped the gigantic sphere of fat heavily, making the mass giggle and quiver and elicit another loud gurgle.

“Come on, belly, we’re almost there.” Misty cooed to silence the black hole within her, “We’ll get this over with soon, and you can go back to eating again, promise.” This tactic seemed to work, as the rest of the way to the Cerulean City Gym it was placated. It was as if it was its own separate being. Meanwhile, Ash, as he observed Misty’s gelatinous behind, swaying up and down and side to side, began to feel, for lack of a better term...strange. An involuntary blush rose to his face as he observed how the sun shined off her blobby mass so brilliantly, and the thought of her only caring about eating more food and getting even larger was exciting for a reason he couldn't understand.

Ash and Misty made their way to the Pokemon Gym with surprising speed, the latter was almost completely unhindered by her blob-like form. The young trainer made his way through the front entrance, whilst the gym leader went around the building to enter through the one designed for her. Stepping inside past the lobby and into the main atrium of the gym, Ash was taken aback by how much...it didn't look like one. It looked like there used to be bleachers for an audience to observe the battles, but that must have been taken out to make way for more of Misty. The pool in the middle of the chamber was devoid of any water, which brought into question how and where a water type battle would take place.

Suddenly, the very far wall began to open itself up, revealing Misty waiting on the other side to walk, or in this case jiggle, in. “You know, for a Pokemon Gym, this place doesn't really...look like one, to be honest.” Ash relented as Misty began to ooze her way inside. The building felt like a husk to him, like it hadn't been used in a very long time.

“Well, that's the way I like it!” Misty giggled as she made her way towards the empty pool. Using a fair amount of her strength, Ash gasped as the red-headed Gym Leader suddenly leaped into the air using her legs and resilient blubber, before falling into the empty pool with a large crash, shaking the building and even putting cracks in the floor around it. Ash fell down to his bottom along with Pikachu on his shoulder and saw that her mass had taken up the entity of the open hole, spilling over the sides as her enormous cleavage were presented to him head-on. “Not a lot of people challenge me anymore, so I basically use this place as my own personal restaurant now.”

“Restaurant?” Ash echoed as he got back to his feet. “What do you mean? We’re obviously the only ones here, and I don’t see any waiters or chefs or-”.
Ash was interrupted as Misty hoisted up her large, saggy pillow of an arm and snapped her pudgy fingers together. A moment later, about a couple dozen Pokemon dressed up in formal outfits came from behind him carrying all sorts of foodstuffs. “These aren't the Pokemon I use to fight with, the townspeople here just gave me them out of the goodness of their hearts.” Misty chuckled as Ash was brushed aside by a Charizard carrying a wedding cake. “I use em’ as my personal servants, cooking food, cleaning up after me, it’s the best!”

“Well, where are your fighting Pokemon? I’m ready to battle!” Ash began to get a little impatient as the Pokemon began setting down plates on her flab, then wiggled up to her open mouth to chow down on.

“Hmph? Oh yeah…” Misty remembered disinterestedly as she chowed down on about half a dozen burgers. “Come on out, Azurill”. Misty fished a puffy arm in between her monumental valley of cleavage and fished out a Pokeball, throwing it towards her gigantic stomach to unravel around, blue mouse Pokemon. The baby Pokemon tried to take a battle stance but only managed in sinking deep within her master’s flab.

“Wait...you want us to have a Pokemon fight on your fat?” Ash thought Misty was joking with all of this, but the sight of her shaking her head only confused even further. “I thought these battles were supposed to take place in water.”

“People tell me that I’m like a huge waterbed!” Misty exclaimed as she shook herself for emphasis, her blubber quivering like waves and smothering her baby Azurill even further. “Besides, my gym, my rules. Now let’s get this battle on, I’m starving!”

The battle commenced between Ash and the water type gym leader, Misty. The redheaded blob, who hadn't fought a Pokemon Battle in years, and whose Pokemon were at a disadvantage against the trainer’s Pikachu, failed the first round, but she wasn't too bothered by this, taking the time before getting out her next Pokeball to feast ion more food. After that, Misty lost again.

And then again.

And again.

And again, and again.

“Huh,” Misty remarked as her last Pokemon was knocked out by Pikachu’s Thundershock. “I lost,” Misty responded to her failure as a Gym Leader by shoveling more food into her mouth, clearly not bothered by it at all.

“Did you hear that Pikachu? We won!” Ash cheered his best buddy as the yellow mouse Pokemon gave an affectionate chirp. The threat of being a billion Pokedollars in debt was daunting, but it turned out he never even had to switch out Pokemon during the whole battle! He then turned his attention back to the gym leader, still eating like there was no tomorrow. “So, uh...may I have my Cascade Badge, now?”

“Oh, sure thing!” Misty remembered she was supposed to give out a little badge if she lost the battle. “Come on up, I got it in between my boobs.”

“...haha, very funny.” Ash rolled his eyes at Misty’s attempt at raunchy humor. “No, really, can I have my badge?”

“No really, I got it right here!” Misty defender herself, making the effort to stop her feast short by once again fishing around her breasts to pull out a shiny, blue badge. "But I'm not going to throw it at you, that would be rude! You want it. come and get it!" She winked, which made Ash blush like mad.

"Al...alright." Ash relented, walking forward towards Misty's expansive stomach to climb on. The slippery, warm surface offered no resistance, and by the time his whole body was on top he had sunk several feet into it. The ten-year-old began to swim slash climb up the gym leader's pale flab, working up a sweat in the process.

"Mmmm...that feels good." Misty moaned as Ash worked his way up her belly and into the cleavage of her minivan-sized breasts. "For a kid, he's kinda cute...I wonder..." Misty began pondering.

After what felt like an eternity, Ash made it to the top of Misty's flab. With a gasp for air, his head popped out of the valley of cleavage where the Cascade Badge was located. "Hey..." Before Ash could make a grab for the Cascade Badge, Misty began to speak, interrupting him. "What's your name, kid?" She questioned from seemingly out of nowhere.

"It's Ash. Ash Ketchum. Why?"

"Ash..."
