1453322222111.content:
Ash attempted to process the words that came out from Misty’s mouth but found them impossible to be arranged in a sentence as she spoke it. Confused and a little bit nervous, Ash gave out a forced smile as he floated on top of the pale ocean that was her flab. “I’m sorry, could you repeat that? I thought you said you wanted to-”.

“-Come with you on your Pokemon Journey?” Misty interrupted him, finishing his sentence before giving a cautious giggle. “Yeah, that’s what I said, and I meant it. What’s not to understand?” The corpulent redhead watched the young trainer still trapped in between her body swallowing breasts, wondering what was going on through his mind.

“Um…” Ash grasped at something to say from his mind, but only managing to draw a blank. “W-why...do you want to do that?”

Misty blinked in response to Ash’s question, and for a full minute, the gym was filled with a deafening silence as she thought long and hard about her answer. “Because I’m hungry.” She finally responded, which made sense. Her entire life had always been about eating and growing fatter. “I’ve never really left Cerulean City before, and I’ve always wanted to try out new foods from other places. I could have always gone on a Pokemon Journey, but that always seemed like too much work. Now that you’re here, I can just tag along!”

“Um...that’s a very nice offer, Miss Misty…” Ash made sure that he thought long and hard on everything Misty said before he responded. “But I don’t think that a traveling buddy is best for me right now. I’m not sure you can even fit on the route, haha.” He made small chuckle to lighten the mood, but Misty’s brow furrowed, not understanding him.


“...ooooh, I get it now!” Misty snapped her fingers in realization, and her serious face soon turned smug. “You thought that I was asking permission to go with you. Sorry Ash, but I’m not asking, I’m stating the facts.”

“Wha-what?!” Ash was taken aback by this sudden change in demeanor, she was usually so jovial and somewhat oblivious. “You can’t do that! Just because you’re a Gym Leader doesn't mean you can push other trainers around!”

“Right...but a million-pound girl and totally push around a little kid wedged in between her breasts” Misty giggled and wobbled her cleavage to shake the Ash around like a ragdoll, making his whole world spin. Every part of her fat was as smooth as butter, but the weight was unbearable when she began playing with it. “I can just keep you inside my two girls until you change your mind, you know.”

“N...no, that okay!” Ash wheezed as he felt the air being ejected forcefully from his lungs by the sheer pressure. “You can come with me, just...can I get out now, please!?”

“If you say so~” Misty purred and fished Ash from the valley of her boobs, dangling him over her fat face for a moment only to drop him on top of her gigantic stomach. “Now’ let’s get out of here. I can’t wait to taste all of the food the world as to offer!”

“Gah...There is more to life than just eating every tasty tidbit that wanders into your line of sight, you know.” Ash grumbled sorely as he began to slide down Misty’s fat towards his Pikachu, who quickly made sure was alright from being squeezed like that earlier. He felt like his life was suddenly being taken over by a beyond obese, hungry girl. “There’s seeing new sights, helping people out-”

“Falling in love?” Misty finished his sentence, making Ash blush like crazy. “Don’t make me barf. Who needs friends when you can be fat? Besides, everyone who ever asked me out only saw me as their own personal feedbag, like that’s all I am!” She began to jiggle her mass backward, hundreds of thousands of pounds lifting up from the empty pool and back onto the gym floor.

“Well...since we’re traveling partners now, what else do you like besides eating?” Ash asked, seriously doubting she ever thought about anything that wasn't food.

“Easy, there's...uh...let’s put a pin in that, for now.” Misty blushed.

That afternoon, Misty took her first 'steps' outside of her hometown of Cerulean City on Route to Vermillion City. She got to opt out of taking the Pokemon Journey by training her Pokemon back home privately, but now she was experiencing the majesty of the Pokemon World in all its beautiful glory! Or...at least the amount of nature that wasn't being smothered by her fat. The placid, sloping road had some trouble fitting her body within the confines of the dirt path, and her lab encroached on the surrounding trees and foliage, downing a few in the process.

"So, this is nature, huh?" Misty observed her surroundings, unimpressed. "Huh, I'm underwhelmed. It's pretty I guess, but It's kinda small. I'll take the city over this stuff any day!" Pokemon in the tall grasses soon found that they had to run away, as an ocean of pale blubber began to threaten to smother them.

I guess it's not for everyone..." Ash mused quietly.

Another day on the road with Ash and Brock, and young Misty Waterflower found herself lost in thought as they headed towards the nearest Pokemon Center. While Ash was going on and on about how he was totally gonna get his next gym badge, Misty was thinking thoughts that she didn't want to admit she was thinking. As unlikely as it seemed, the water-type trainer had an ever-growing crush on this enthusiastic Pokemon-loving boy who she met when he stole (and wrecked) her bike.

He was impulsive, yes. He was temperamental, yes. He was shorter than her, yes. But behind the rough and tumble, tomboy exterior Misty displayed, she was a romatic through and through. And Ash's heart called to her like a Venomoth to a flame. Everything about him was just so sincere, so utterly authentic that she knew if he said something, he meant it. He was the type of person who would give someone the shirt off his back, even if it meant he would freeze to death in the process. He might complain a lot while doing it, but he would do it.

That type of personality was just so rare. And his never-wavering determination to become stronger and a better trainer while making friends with Pokemon everywhere, her admiration for him only increased. But unfortunately, Misty also had some negative thoughts flowing through her mind. Mainly the intrusive idea that she just wasn't attractive enough to get Ash's attention...the way she wanted it, anyway.

Oh they were friends, sure. They had fun, they bickered, they had each other's backs. But as far as romantic attraction? Ash barely noticed her. To be fair, that was the case with most girls, but every once in a while she would see Ash's eyes light up at the sight of a girl...mainly that one girl in that one photo that she refused to even speak her name because of it...and it bothered her that he didn't look at her the same way.

And why should he? She was the runt of the litter after all. Her sisters were all older, taller, curvier, name it. They were superior in every way except for probably brains. But that didn't catch eyes. There had to be a way to get his attention, something that would get him to notice her...and that's when she got a crazy idea...so crazy it just might work.

As soon as they reached the Pokemon Center, Brock went into town to get groceries for their dinner that evening, while Ash went out to do some training. As soon as he was focused, Misty snuck over to his Pokeballs to grab Bulbasaur's ball, and then zipped off before Ash could have a chance to notice what she was up to. She giggled as she went into their room and locked the door, releasing Bulbasuar who was very confused.

"Bulba?"

"Hi Bulbasaur...I was wondering if you could do me a favor?"

"Bulba?"

"Well..." Now Misty blushed, as she wasn't really sure how to phrase her question. "Do you uh...do you happen to know the move called Growth by any chance?" Misty sighed as all she got from the Pokemon was a puzzled tilt of its head. "You see...I was hoping you could uh...try to use it on me...specifically my...breasts?"

And as the pokedex stated that the little green Poison-Type's stomach acid could dissolve virtually anything...

"Ooh dear... This...might be bad..." Misty said with concern.

Misty waited a few minutes with little but her heartbeat to break the silence. Nothing. Soon it became half an hour. Still nothing. It seemed like the mysterious liquid was about as effective as a Magikarp's Splash now: no effect whatsoever. Part of the giant redhead was relieved she wasn't about to outgrow the planet in a second or something, but the other part was disappointed if not a little upset she couldn't grow any larger like she had wanted.

"Well that was eventful..." Misty sarcastically remarked, her arms crossed beneath her slightly amplified bosom and making them a bit more prominent. It was then she felt a gentle tap by her foot, so she looked down to see what was tapping her.

To her surprise, it turned out to be the old saleswoman from earlier who had sold her the liquid in the first place. "Are you surprised, my dear? Were you intending to outgrow everything and beyond?" the old lady said with seeming mild amusement.

Misty knelt down to speak to the old lady better and shook her head. "N-no! I was only aiming for a bit larger! ...Waaaait a minute. You knew the stuff you sold would do this to me! What's the big idea?!" she shouted, her temper starting to get the better of her.

The old woman simply smiled and said, "Of course. Though if you were aiming for much, much greater heights I certainly wouldn't stop you. Indeed, there's nothing preventing you from becoming larger or smaller, dear."

Misty balled her hands into fists as she angrily shouted, "What is that even supposed to mean?! Your stuff didn't do anything after the first few sips, so unless you tell me right now what you're getting at, I'll-"

The old lady put her hand up in a calming gesture and explained, "Apologies, dear, the formula has unexpected initial effects. Even I could not inform you of what would happen after the initial taste. If you wish to change your size now, you need only focus on the desired size. Shrink to the size where you could live on an atom like we do on this world, or grow until this universe is subatomic to you. Or anything in between or beyond. No size is impossible for you to become if you focus on it, and you may focus on specific body parts to certain degrees. Only your undergarments will change size with you, and only for as long as you wear them, however. I'm not a miracle worker, you know."

Misty was of course skeptical of the old lady, but figured it worth a try. First she focused on her boobs, making them roughly C-cup. She tried for more, but found that they wouldn't respond beyond their current proportional size. Then she focused on her entire body and made herself...

1541322.content:
Go smaller for now. Sure, being 80 feet tall was an amazing experience. And of course Misty still would like to grow even larger! ...But there was a challenger to the gym approaching, polishing his newly gotten Boulder Badge. More than likely he would stop to rest in the Poke Center for the day and prepare to challenge her gym. And her sisters wouldn't be back for the rest of the week, AND would just give the boy a Cascade Badge! That's not how the gym is supposed to be run! The gym leader, herself in this case, was supposed to test the challenger and make him or her earn the badge.

...Not to mention all the back-breaking work Misty had to put into making more Cascade Badges, which she learned the hard way some time ago. She wasn't about to give over one of them to just anyone.

So Misty shrank herself down to about her original size, but kept her proportionately enhanced bust. The now 5'5" tall girl then ran inside the gym, stopping only to retrieve the Poke balls of her pokemon. She got dressed in her gym leader attire, finding it a little tight but she didn't have enough time to get herself fitted for a new swimsuit. THEN she left for the Poke Center to go greet the challenger, and perhaps see if she can discern anything about him that she should watch out for.

The boy had long red hair reaching down to his shoulders, and was decked out in an admittedly snazzy black shirt with red trim. Blue pants and black shoes with more red trim completed his outfit. But it was his eyes that caught Misty's attention: serious, almost intimidatingly mean. Yet, his Feraligatr seemed to like him and he also had a Crobat, so he couldn't actually be all that nasty, right?

Just then, her Psyduck let itself out of its ball and waddled along to the boy. He gave it a leer that would likely give a Rhyhorn second thoughts, but Psyduck merely tilted its head with a, "...Psy?" Misty groaned, held out its poke ball, and said, "What have I told you about popping out of your poke ball without permission? Psyduck, return!" and in a beam or red light, Psyduck was back in its ball.

The boy looked up at her and said, "You...should really have a better handle on your Psyduck." Misty could have sworn he was about to bite her head off over the incident, but bit his tongue and held back instead. Probably for the best, considering Misty's own temper could erupt like a geyser.

"I've been trying... But mine isn't particularly bright. It...doesn't even know how to swim..." Misty admitted. Probably a bad thing to admit such a weakness in one of her team, but when its headache worsens...it could prove to be quite formidable despite its lack of swimming knowledge for a Water-Type. She then asked, "So, what's your name? I'd like to at least know the name of my challenger."

"So the Cerulean City gym leader has a weak pokemon that she relies on..." the boy mumbled, but then said, "Oh, sorry! I've only recently learned the proper way of raising my team. It took some losses, including one to Lance of the Elite Four, to teach me what I was doing wrong... The name's Silver, and that's...all you need to know."

155332222222222222222322221.content:
Okay, big big Misty! And how is the tomboyish mermaid going to reach such mind-boggling sizes? Here are a couple ideas to start us off:

A Blessing from Above
I strange, never before seen comet is passing by the planet for the first time ever. It's got people talking, but most aren't feeling much beyond mild curiosity, including Misty. But even so, she's still compelled to go out and see it the night it first becomes visible in the sky, completely unaware of what's to come.

Every Encounter is a Chance to Grow
Receiving a challenge from a Trainer? Totally normal. Receiving a challenge from an insanely tall and curvy female Trainer who's in the middle of a growth spurt? Not so much. And it's exactly such an encounter that leaves a lasting impression on Misty, in more ways than one.

Of course, you're always free to make your own if these options don't cut if for you.

Misty wakes up the next morning to find herself floating in the pond.
Misty has a strange dream... Or does she? It's surreal, but it feels so real.
1553322222222222222223222211.content:
The Conjoined Twins Comet. True to its name, it looked like two smaller comets stuck together. Both halves were almost perfectly spherical too, judging by the satellite photos taken when it first came within range of the planet. The news played it up as some "astounding astrological anomaly" that astronomers were "hard at work trying to comprehend," but most people would just take one look at the pictures and say something like, "Huh, that's kinda weird." Then it was discovered the comet gave off red light that turned purple partway down the tail before turning blue at the end. That got people talking, though some still didn't care much.

Misty was part of the latter group. It sounded unique, of course, but she never had any interest in space stuff. Specializing in Water-type Pokemon kept her interests closer to the ground. Still, she had to admit it was interesting, which was why she wasn't really bothered by all the Trainers rushing to get their Gym challenges out of the way for the last week. She even decided to close the Gym early that Friday, the night the comet was supposed to first become visible in the sky, though that was just so she had some extra time to relax from all the battling.

So the Cerulean Gym closed its doors for the day in the early evening. Misty sighed with relief as she locked the entrance. "Finally," she said, the word sounding more like another sigh. But she couldn't let the fatigue set in just yet; her Pokemon still needed to be settled in for the night. Thank goodness the custodial staff could handle the clean-up for her, at least.

Her body went into autopilot as she set about tending to her Pokemon. Feeding them, washing them (pool water did not count as a bath!), tending to their injuries. All things she'd done a million times before.

"I should treat myself," she thought aloud at one point. The rush hadn't been especially bad compared to holiday seasons or anything, but still. "But what to do? I haven't had a proper swim all week, but... No, too tired. Maybe I'll just take a relaxing dip? Not in the pool, though. I've had enough chlorine for one day."

Thankfully, she already had a good spot in mind: A secluded pond, nestled away somewhere between the city and Mt. Moon. Since it was still the middle of Summer, it wouldn't be too cold to relax in the water even if she didn't get there until after nightfall. Plus it would give her a good view the sky, perfect for checking out the comet. Not that she was in a rush to see it or anything--it was estimated to be visible for about a week--but it felt like an appropriate bonus for all her hard work.

She had to leave as soon as she finished up, though. It was an hour's walk to the pond, plus another hour back home. Not to mention however long she'd spend at the pond itself. Come to think of it, she should really take Saturday off. Sunday too.

Right as Misty finished up with Lapras, the last of her Pokemon, her stomach grumbled. She looked down at herself, then back up at Lapras. They held each other's gaze for a moment. Then realization hit Misty. Dinner. She giggled sheepishly. "Guess I better get something to eat before anything, huh?" she said, more to herself than Lapras.

------

Night had fallen by the time Misty arrived. The pond sat in the middle of three hills, two on the side closer to Mt. Moon while the third blocked it from view on the Cerulean City side. It was a bit oddly shaped, like it kept flip-flopping between being an oval or a rectangle before settling for something in between and then drooped on one side. Water-type Pokemon couldn't live there, so the most it had in terms of wildlife was the occasional bird Pokemon stopping by for a drink or some rest. No plants either. All in all, an unassuming spot that only worked as a short reprieve from society.

Which was exactly why Misty liked it so much. After the week she'd had, she couldn't imagine a better spot to de-stress. Sure, she had spent dinner arguing with herself that the trip there and back would be worth the sore legs tomorrow, but such was life.

All was still, even the wind. The pond's surface reflected the night sky almost as well as a mirror could, even the comet. Its red glow dominated the surface. Though just a reflection, Misty found herself gazing at it in wonder, as if transfixed. "Pretty," she said.

As she continued staring, she took off her jacket and stepped out of her sandals, leaving her in just her one-piece swimsuit. Not because she wanted to swim (she talked herself out of it during dinner) but because she wanted to make the trip as soon as possible. The more time she spent in the comfort of her home, the more she ran the risk of just going straight to bed. And while that sounded nice...

"I really need this." Why Misty kept telling herself this, she had no idea. She knew full well how exhausting the week had been, even if said exhaustion wouldn't truly catch up to her until tomorrow. And it wasn't like she absolutely had to visit the pond; there were plenty of other ways to reward herself. Yet the idea had taken hold of her mind and wouldn't let her talk herself into any alternative. She had to go to the pond, and she had to see the comet on the very first night.

That last part in particular struck her as odd. She wasn't exactly dying to see the comet, yet at the same time...she was? Or not really dying to see it, just...more curious then she thought? Yeah, that's it. Just a simple case of underestimated curiosity. Nothing more.

"Pretty," she said again. Even in the pond's reflection, the comet's red glow proved striking. A shame the body of water was too small to contain its tail; it only reached the starting point of its transition from red to purple.

Laying down in the grass at the base of one of the hills, Misty turned her gaze up to the sky. If the reflection was enticing, then the real deal was utterly captivating. She couldn't explain it. The intensity of its colors, the way said colors transitioned from one to another so perfectly, and that vaguely supernatural wonder of it exuded could hold a person's interest for dear life and never let go. A shame those photos couldn't do it justice.

Misty sighed, feeling herself relaxing. A weight fell on her eyelids, though not to the point of closing them. Instead her eyes just became half-lidded. Her vision narrowed, blocking out most of the night sky, the comet dominating her vision.

Conjoined Twins... Not a bad name for it. Fit the rock itself, at the very least, though the shape did inspire comparisons to...other things. Crude, but Misty couldn't deny it made her think of breasts. Which was odd, since she never thought much about such things otherwise. It wasn't like other people's comparisons to private parts sparked the notion either. The very first time she saw the satellite photos, breasts immediately came to mind. Weird.

But she didn't feel up to contemplating recurring intrusive thoughts. Tonight she just wanted to de-stress and enjoy her comet-viewing in peace. Just forget about Gyms and Badges and whatever else for a little while, and enjoy the space rock with all the pretty colors...
1553322222222222222223222211.title: A Blessing from Above

Disclaimer: I own nothing in this interactive

This interactive is centered around Misty, the Gym leader of Cerulean city. You either love or hate this redhead, and now you can do whatever you want to her. Just don't expect me to add unless it gets interesting!

Do not change the story path.

No being stupid and ending the story path because you don't like it

No bashing characters aside from Misty, the rival trainers, or the bad guys

And...well...I'll write more rules later if necessary.
